A lightning-fast website for a reputable cybersecurity company in Ukraine

Client

Berezha Security Group is a cybersecurity services company focused on application security, penetration testing, and data security consulting.

Since 2014, the company has delivered 200+ projects for over 100 clients worldwide. Its customers come from a range of business sectors, including software engineering, fintech, retail, healthcare, media, gaming, legal and advisory, and others.

Industry: Cybersecurity
Location: Ukraine

Challenge

In 2020, Berezha Security Group rebranded as BSG. The next logical step was redesigning the brand book and the corporate website. But redesign was only part of the story. The ultimate goal was to make the website fast and SEO-friendly, keeping its Google PageSpeed Insights scores in the green 90-100 range. The upgrade was expected to be gradual, with the original URL kept intact to maintain ranking on Google.

Certain functions were to stay, too. For example, the website administrator reserved the right to change content without the programmer's or layout designer's help – just like with the previous, WordPress-powered website.

Developing a tool for pre-qualifying leads came as an extra task.
"With Implex's help, we were able to achieve the proper look and feel for our website, with the required metrics for the response time and page loading time. I think the engagement of the management, who are the co-founders at the same time and who are focused on problem-solving, is definitely a positive differentiator of Implex."
Andriy Varusha
COO and co-founder

Solution

Design
Our UI/UX specialist collaborated with BSG's marketing director to create a new design fully matching the updated brand book and the client's expectations. An Implex engineer developed a sophisticated dynamic wizard form to pre-qualify leads and integrated it into a static website.
The company's blog was kept as a separate WordPress website. It was only redesigned to fit the new brand book.
Optimization
The updated website works much faster, as static pages are now generated at frontend build-time using React components.

Building a new CMS from scratch equaled budget overrun. To avoid that, we reused the repository web editor. The website admin can edit existing pages or create new ones using readily available blocks.
The tools and technologies we used were:

Results

  • A brand-new design comes with perfect usability and successfully represents the BSG brand.
  • The website scores a gorgeous 95-100 on Google PageSpeed Insights for desktop and mobile.
  • Modular code lets the website admin reuse the existing elements to create new pages.
  • An updated deployment scheme empowers the admin to make changes, deploy them in the test environment in one click, run tests, and send them to the production environment – again in just one click.
  • If an error pops up, the admin can easily roll back to any of the previous website versions.
  • YOY
    A cross-platform mobile application that helps to learn the Ukrainian language to kids whose native language is Hungarian or Romanian. Developed for schoolchildren, it is simple, logical, concise, and at the same time, attractive and low resource-consuming to work fast, even on old mobile devices. The app has been created in partnership with a digital agency, "Friends of Brands," for the program of cooperation between Ukraine, Finland, and the EU aims to support the reform of the New Ukrainian School (NUSch).
  • WikiArt.org
    The aim of the project was to make art accessible to anyone, anywhere. Today, WikiArt features over 250,000 artworks by 5,000 artists, localized to 8 languages. These artworks are displayed in museums, universities and town halls of more than 100 countries, yet most of it is not on public view. The client claims that they are planning to cover the entire art history of the Earth, from cave artworks to modern private collections.
  • SmartLane
    A B2B startup for car dealers who sell used vehicles across the USA via the marketplace. The developed application has a whole range of functions to support the workflows of car dealers and inspectors, like auctions workflow, live and proxy bidding, post-auction counter offering, and deal closing. The solution is integrated with different APIs to gather information about vehicles, helping dealers make the right decisions at auctions.
  • Admit.me
    Admit.me is a free virtual admissions coach that offers step-by-step guides through the admissions process of the best schools. The developed solution allows for generating personalized admissions programs based on the applicant's background and goals. Admit.me provides tools and lessons designed to optimize the applicant's admissions chances by framing the applicant's thinking and informing critical admissions decisions.
  • BSG.tech
    A cybersecurity services company Berezha Security Group rebranded as BSG in 2020. So they needed to improve their website, but redesign was only part of the story. The ultimate goal was to make the website fast and SEO-friendly, keeping its Google PageSpeed Insights scores in the green 90-100 range, what's impossible using a WordPress-like CMS approach. A static website with perfect usability, external CMS and one-click deployment functionality, and revision control successfully represents the BSG brand now.
